Posts.Content: Hi all Yesterday I received my 7th and final chemo, picc line removed, can’t expkain the relief of getting through this first phase. Having followed your journeys I realise how lucky I have been, no stay overs in hospital, only one chemo cancelled due to sore throat, not saying it’s nern easy but I think I’ve been lucky. Four weeks respite now before my mastectomy which I’m hoping will be easier than the last 22 weeks. Wishing you all well Love Tracy x
Posts.Title: Just had lady chemo

Posts.Content: Hi all Hope I am now posting in the April chemo thread, don’t know why I struggle must be my chemo brain. So on Sunday I was not halfway through my first part of my breast cancer journey but yesterday had my forth of 7 so 4 down three to go. What a hideous day, up at 6; on bus at 7..30, arrived at bhoc at 8.55, new picc line inserted, started an hour and a half infusion of herceptin, 15 minute flush, two hour break to unsure no reaction, an hour of Pertuzumab, new drug funded by the drugs council, 15 minute flush, then hour of T followed by 15 minute flush left oncology at 5.35 arrived home at 7pm, emotionally and physically exhausted. Thankfully no reactions so three weeks from now should only be 4.5 hrs of infusion.  Having read all your comments I am now awaiting the hideous side effects these poisons bring.  Today I have to ring southmead to inform them I’m four down so they can book in my mastectomy, how long after your final chemos did you have to wait for surgery.? You are all so inspiring and positive in your responses and for that I thank you ❤️
Posts.Title: Over the halfway mark of my first journey

Posts.Content: Hi Jenny R I’m around the same stage as you, due first T on 16th smdblike yoi wondering what to expect. Have been given steroids to start taking day before which I guess tells a story in its self. Strangely looking forward to peoples responses to your questions Best wishes Tracy
Posts.Title: *** April 2018 Breast Cancer Chemo Club ***

Posts.Content: Hi had my round 4 last Monday and found the side effects much worse than the Fec but I guess with the two targetting agents alongside I should’ve expected it. Like you I’m having my op after 7 rounds of chemo. I can physically feel the lump has shrunk but having mri Monday to see if the chemo has done its stuff.  Oh the joys hope it continues to not effect you too bad xxx
Posts.Title: *** April 2018 Breast Cancer Chemo Club ***
